channel.title: Little Simple Question!
channel.description: How can i make this game a little bit normal? What i want to say is how can i lower the xp u get if u attack? And how can i change what the NPC and what the player hits?

item.title: Little Simple Question!
item.dc:creator: @I_Hawk_I I Hawk I
item.description:
@I_Hawk_I wrote:

You can’t really… not that I know of, but there isn’t much point - you have access to changing the xp rates, therefore giving more or less exp between each level

Read full topic

item.title: Little Simple Question!
item.dc:creator: @xweetok599 xweetok599
item.description:
@xweetok599 wrote:

And how can i change xp needed for next level?

Read full topic

item.title: Little Simple Question!
item.dc:creator: @SirPali SirPali
item.description:
@SirPali wrote:

Yes. Well, all melee weapons I believe.
This code will be in client.java a few times, for melee, range, and magic (and possible pvp, not sure about that).
Just change them all to your desired rate.

Read full topic

item.title: Little Simple Question!

@xweetok599 wrote:

Does this count for all weapons?

Read full topic

item.title: Little Simple Question!
item.dc:creator: @SirPali SirPali
item.description:
@SirPali wrote:

The 750 and 700 = the amount of exp you get * your hit.
If you hit 5 while using the accurate attack style, you will get 5*750 attack exp.
Change those numbers to your desired exp rate.

Read full topic

item.title: Little Simple Question!
item.dc:creator: @xweetok599 xweetok599
item.description:
@xweetok599 wrote:

I don’t understand. Im not really a prof. This is what i see

server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].updateRequired = true;
server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].hitUpdateRequired = true;
double TotalExp = 0;

                    inCombat();
                    if (FightType == 1) // Accurate
                    {
                        TotalExp = (double) (750 * hitDiff);
                        TotalExp = (double) (TotalExp * CombatExpRate);
                        addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), playerAttack);
                    } else if (FightType == 2) // Agressive
                    {
                        TotalExp = (double) (750 * hitDiff);
                        TotalExp = (double) (TotalExp * CombatExpRate);
                        addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), playerStrength);
                    } else if (FightType == 4) // Defensive
                    {
                        TotalExp = (double) (750 * hitDiff);
                        TotalExp = (double) (TotalExp * CombatExpRate);
                        addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), playerDefence);
                    } else if (FightType == 3) // Controlled
                    {
                        TotalExp = (double) (700 * hitDiff);
                        TotalExp = (double) (TotalExp * Comba

item.title: Little Simple Question!
item.dc:creator: @I_Hawk_I I Hawk I
item.description:
@I_Hawk_I wrote:

For combat skill experience look for:

addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), playerAttack); addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), playerDefence); addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), playerStrength);

above it it should have something along the lines of:

if (UseBow || UseCrossBow || UseRing) { TotalExp = (double)(800*hitDiff); TotalExp = (double)(TotalExp*CombatExpRate); addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), 4); } else if (FightType != 3) { TotalExp = (double)(800*hitDiff); TotalExp = (double)(TotalExp*CombatExpRate); addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), SkillID); } else { TotalExp = (double)(800*hitDiff); TotalExp = (double)(TotalExp*CombatExpRate);

Change the things in red to whatever you need.

and for special attack damage for a weapon

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 4151 && specialAmount > 49){ AttackingOn2.specGFX(341); specialAmount -= 49; hitDiff = misc.random(playerMaxHit) + misc.random(StrPrayer) + misc.random(voidmelee); lastSpecial = System.currentTimeMillis(); setAnimation(1658); actionInterval = getbattleTimer(); lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis(); specOn = false; }

The amount of damage
The special GFX, when using items with a spec
The animation for special hit

This is only for special attacks, you’ll have to find out for yourself how to change the normal attack damage. but you can use item.cfg to change stats which will increase damage. Just do some experimenting, but im sure theres a tut or two around to help.

NPC damage is under NPChandler.Java : look for the NPC you are looking to change, and edit the hitdiff etc…
feel free to experiment with this

Read full topic
